text: well my reaction to hearing about the
Nobel Prize was one of um uh shock and
disbelief in fact I can remember very
very well when this happened I was
attending a meeting in California
meeting of the American physical society
and the optical Society of America
meeting
jointly uh out in California in Long
Beach California and the day before the
prizes were announced a number of of us
were sitting around after the scientific
sessions were over speculating about who
was going to get The Nobel Prize that
year and believe me nobody brought up my
name uh so later that night well it was
the middle of the night uh that I got a
call uh in my hotel room uh to the
effect that I had uh shared the Nobel
Prize with Claude K tanji and Steve Chu
uh came as a complete
shock my life changed dramatically um uh
it's very difficult for me to keep up
with all of the invitations that I get
to uh speak uh about my work um uh the
size of my research group has has grown
that's made it possible for me to be
involved in more and more new kinds of
physics but it's made it harder and
harder for me to be intimately familiar
with all the things that are going on so
there's a kind of a of a tension between
the joy in doing lots of new things and
the desire to understand them better and
better um another thing that I never
would have imagined would have been uh
one of the results
of um becoming a Nobel Laureate is that
I ended up meeting people who are
actually
famous so you know people say oh you're
noal you must be famous no nobody
remembers you know outside of the the
field in which you're working nobody
remembers who won the Nobel Prize even a
couple years ago uh but as a result of
being a Nobel La I get invited to uh uh
to things where I've met people who are
actually famous but one of the people
that I have met who has been most
Charming uh is Dr Ruth
westimer uh she lives in New York City
and uh I see her probably about once a
year and she's just a wonderfully uh
warm and uh and genuine person just just
a just a joy to know as a friend
